titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the R. Calvert Haws Papers, 1920-1932
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, printed matter, memorabilia, and photographs, relating to the Presidential campaign of 1932, and to Japanese-American foreign relations.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], R. Calvert Haws Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

did.unittitle: Badge, pass, and certificate of appointment (Assistant Sergeant-at-Arms) from the Republican National Convention at Chicago, June 14, 1932
Photo of Herbert Hoover and thank-you letter to R. C. Haws for his service in the Republican Party (both framed and dated November 8, 1928)
Enlargement of a cartoon in the Chicago Tribune on farmers and farming, 1928
Correspondence, reports, maps, charts, pamphlets, clippings, and photographs pertaining to American-Japanese relations and to the anticipated "American Bureau of Japanese Information"
